answers.answer: No but that can be a side effect from the swelling or the bp meds. My dr had me on one bp med that was giving me fibromyalgia symptoms before swapping me to labetalol.
Thats potassium. Eat a banana.. or a baked patatoe. Spinach. And see. That is not a sign of preeclampsia.
Oh okay thanks! I used to eat a lot of potatoes and bananas in my early pregnancy so now they make me sick lol

The cramping comes from the extra blood flow that we have during pregnancy on top of hormones that relax and tense muscles sporadically. With pre ecalmpsia you need to watch for extra swelling...I started having numbness in my hands a few weeks ago and the doctor said its just all the extra blood. They test your urine at most of your doctors visits looking for the protein that causes the ecampsia. If you notice you have frequent headaches high blood pressure and lots of swelling it may be but muscles cramping is usually just your hormones causing trouble
Oh okay the reason im asking is ive been having a lot of cramping and headaches lately and I was told a lot of headaches are a sign but I didn't know about cramps... thanks :)
Its not so much a lot if headaches but a constant headache that wont shift with hydration or tylenol so I wouldn't worry too much about that especially if its not accompanied by visiual disturbance.
Okay i figured it was bc I been sleeping a ridiculously long amount of time lately lol

question: Is constantly cramping a symptom? I mean constantly, my hands, feet, arms, legs cramping all the time
title: preeclampsia
